titleStmt.title: Jacobs ladder, or A short treatise laying forth distinctly the seuerall degrees of Gods eternall purpose whereby his grace descends vpon the elect, and the elect ascend to the predestinate glory.
Jacobs ladder.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by William Hall, for Nathaniel Butter,

notesStmt.note: "A dialogue about iustification by faith" has separate dated title page, pagination and register. "A receite against heresie" has separate half title and pagination; "A sermon of sanctification or new creation" has separate dated title page and pagination; "A sermon of the spirituall combat" has separate half title and pagination; register is continuous throughout.
The date on the "Dialogue" sub-title page varies: 1610 or 1611.
"A dialogue about justification by faith" identified as STC 25794a on UMI microfilm, reel 1225.
Reproductions of the originals in the British Library and the Bodleian Library ("Dialogue" only).
Appears at reel 1192 (British Library copy) and at reel 1225 (Bodleian Library copy "Dialogue" only).
